intro: Lasiandra dubia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate white flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing as if they are floating in the air. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
